Let's find the pattern that connects each number.

$2\underset{\blueD?}{{\rightarrow}}6\underset{\blueD?}{\rightarrow} 10 \underset{\blueD?}{\rightarrow} 14$

The pattern starts at $2$ and adds $4$ each time.

$2\underset{\blueD{+~4}}{{\rightarrow}}6\underset{\blueD{+~4}}{\rightarrow} 10 \underset{\blueD{+~4}}{\rightarrow} 14$

So, if we want to know what the $6$th number will be, we need to extend the pattern:

$\overset{\greenD1}2\underset{\blueD{+~4}}{{\rightarrow}}\overset{\greenD2}6\underset{\blueD{+~4}}{\rightarrow} \overset{\greenD3}{10} \underset{\blueD{+~4}}{\rightarrow} \overset{\greenD4} {14} \underset{\blueD{+~4}}{\rightarrow} \overset{\greenD5}{18} \underset{\blueD{+~4}}{\rightarrow} \overset{\greenD6}{22}$
The $6^{\text{th}}$ number in the pattern will be $22$.
